result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nhia Yang

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 30, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services_08-24-2022
ADA Vechinski appears; Deft appears in person; SPD still looking for counsel;
Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 20, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

No contact with victim(s): XL or XL's residence; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:10 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Greg Venturini in person. 
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $2,500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): XL or XL's residence. 
- Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

BRANCH 2 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 9/20/2022 at 3:10 pm.
